content.question: An air-filled parallel plate capacitor has an area of <math alttext="0.002 meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>0.002</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math> and a separation of <math alttext="0.003 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.003</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math>. A battery of unknown voltage is connected to the capacitor resulting in an electric field between the plates of magnitude <math alttext="12 kilovolts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>12</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>. With the battery connected, a dielectric <math alttext="open parenthesis, kappa equals 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>Îº</mi></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>=</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is inserted into the capacitor. What is the new electric field in the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="48 kilovolts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>48</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="12 kilovolts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>12</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3 kilovolts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>3</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0.75 kilovolt per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>0.75</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilovolts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>12</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kV/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
